name: sfchronicle
text: BART will work to change its law enforcement model, emphasizing social services instead of officers with guns, as the transit agency heeds reform calls from the Black Lives Matter movement. https://t.co/FWsuwcTnf2

name: sfchronicle
text:
If nothing else, the toppling of three bronze sculptures last week in Golden Gate Park underscored a blunt fact: The age of heroic statuary has reached a dead end, writes @JohnKingSFChron. 

https://t.co/iLNpUKQ4BW

name: sfchronicle
text:
As coronavirus infections surge in California, health and infectious disease experts say the state is entering a "second wave" as people let their guard down with relaxed safety measures and businesses reopening. 

https://t.co/w99cQFt9o8

name: sfchronicle
text:
Eleven years ago, the Warriors drafted a baby-faced guard from a little-known college. The rest is history.

Last year, @annkillion reflected on the moment that altered the course of the franchise:

https://t.co/1HbR3iadbK

name: sfchronicle
text: Local health departments reported a daily increase of 221 coronavirus cases among California health care workers Wednesday. Follow for more live updates: https://t.co/NC3Evu9ati

name: sfchronicle
text: New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced that COVID-19 hospitalizations in the state fell to under 1,000 on Wednesday, for the first time since March 18. https://t.co/ytmKU9a53g

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: California has surpassed 200,000 coronavirus cases since the start of the pandemic, according to data compiled by The Chronicle. See each case, mapped out and visualized, on our Virus Tracker. https://t.co/rE96UKbikc

name: sfchronicle
text:
Madison Bumgarner disciples are in mourning. 

The universal DH has been installed for the MLB season due to begin in July, and this is no emergency tactic, writes @Bruce_Jenkins1. https://t.co/Gs7t9yyxBb

name: sfchronicle
text:
A second wave of coronavirus infections could slow the job market down even more. If that happens, “we’d go right back to where we were in March and April” when millions of people lost work, experts warn. 

Read more: https://t.co/k47ogc2jhb https://t.co/aCSgWvPxdX

name: sfchronicle
text:
Willy T. Ribbs' phone is suddenly ringing off the hook.

The pioneer race car driver from San Jose, who tried to break down racing’s racial barriers from the late '70s to the '90s, is concerned Bubba Wallace could be a sacrificial lamb. https://t.co/ExRh3MHNkN

name: sfchronicle
text: California becomes first state to require trucks to go emissions-free: New rule forces automakers to sell minimum number of zero-emissions big rigs, delivery vans and pickups, starting in 2024. https://t.co/5wndCv3Odk

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: Coronavirus outbreak at San Quentin State Prison reaches Death Row, where more than 160 condemned prisoners are infected. 

One inmate who refused to be tested was found dead Wednesday night — officials still determining cause. https://t.co/hPH8yi8zYF

name: sfchronicle
text:
No fans? No problem. The @SFGiants plan to display cutouts of season-ticket holders' images at Oracle Park for the abbreviated, 60-game season.

Fans without season tickets can pay $99 to have their images produced as cutouts.

https://t.co/jh0yuCq3eJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
A proposal to expand California's Consumer Privacy Act has qualified for the ballot. 

It would give people more control over sensitive information and triple penalties for companies that break laws for collecting and selling children's information.

https://t.co/wu8XTezZGW

name: sfchronicle
text: A BART board director called the leader of the Confederate Army an “exemplary gentleman” in a public meeting Thursday — an abrupt and controversial statement that briefly derailed a discussion on Black Lives Matter and policing. https://t.co/d8XwcxhEDx

name: sfchronicle
text: It's an "added benefit" for @SFGiants fans: an opportunity to be at Oracle Park even when they're home watching the game. https://t.co/WJXo1G28C1

name: sfchronicle
text: As much performer as activist, the creator of the rainbow flag also made memorable protest drag costumes. https://t.co/qcazotCf7t
